resources.name: An Online Catalog of Human Genes and Genetic Disorders

externalReferences.description: Cockayne syndrome type A: novel mutations in eight typical patients

query:
From the following patient information, what is the most likely diagnosis? Use multiple queries or reasoning steps as necessary, and provide a rank-ordered list of up to 10 diagnoses, even if there is insufficient information to make a definitive diagnosis. If you are unsure, provide a list of possible diagnoses with the most likely one first.

Patient ID: Family 5 individual 10Y11M
Patient age: 10 years, 11 months
Patient sex: Female
Patient features: Failure to thrive, Microcephaly, Deeply set eye, Prominent nose, Carious teeth, Cerebral atrophy, Cerebellar atrophy, Ventriculomegaly, Basal ganglia calcification, Retinal pigment epithelial mottling, Severe short stature, Cutaneous photosensitivity, Global developmental delay, Sensorineural hearing impairment, Joint contracture.
Excluded patient features: None.

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"search_terms":["Failure to thrive","Microcephaly","Deeply set eye","Prominent nose","Carious teeth","Cerebral atrophy","Cerebellar atrophy","Ventriculomegaly","Basal ganglia calcification","Retinal pigment epithelial mottling","Severe short stature","Cutaneous photosensitivity","Global developmental delay","Sensorineural hearing impairment","Joint contracture"]}

messages.name: search

function.name: run_query
function.arguments: {"query":"MATCH (d:biolink_Disease)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(p:biolink_PhenotypicFeature) WHERE p.id IN ['HP:0001508','HP:0000252','HP:0000490','HP:0000448','HP:0000670','HP:0002059','HP:0001272','HP:0002119','HP:0002135','HP:0007814','HP:0003510','HP:0000992','HP:0001263','HP:0000407','HP:0034392'] WITH d, count(p) AS matched_phenotypes ORDER BY matched_phenotypes DESC LIMIT 20 MATCH (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(allp:biolink_PhenotypicFeature) RETURN d, matched_phenotypes, collect(allp.name) AS all_phenotypes ORDER BY matched_phenotypes DESC LIMIT 10"}

It is characterized by xeroderma pigmentosum, mental retardation, dwarfism, hypogonadism, and neurologic abnormalities.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0016006', 'caption': 'Cockayne syndrome', 'name': 'Cockayne syndrome', 'description': 'A multisystem condition characterized by short stature, a characteristic facial appearance, premature aging, photosensitivity, progressive neurological dysfunction, and intellectual deficit.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014213', 'caption': 'intellectual disability-feeding difficulties-developmental delay-microcephaly syndrome', 'name': 'intellectual disability-feeding difficulties-developmental delay-microcephaly syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0033007', 'caption': 'Galloway-Mowat syndrome 3', 'name': 'Galloway-Mowat syndrome 3', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0008393', 'caption': 'Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to CREBBP mutations', 'name': 'Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to CREBBP mutations', 'description': 'Any Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CREBBP gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0012176', 'caption': 'Emanuel syndrome', 'name': 'Emanuel syndrome', 'description': 'Emanuel syndrome is a constitutional genomic disorder due to the presence of a supernumerary derivative 22 chromosome and characterized by severe intellectual disability, characteristic facial dysmorphism (micrognathia, hooded eyelids, upslanting downslanting parebral fissures, deep set eyes, low hanging columnella and long philtrum), congenital heart defects and kidney abnormalities.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0054782', 'caption': 'leukodystrophy, hypomyelinating, 15', 'name': 'leukodystrophy, hypomyelinating, 15', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}], 'edges': []}}, 'result_as_table': {'type': 'table', 'data': []}}
messages.name: run_query

messages.content:
Based on the patient's features—failure to thrive, microcephaly, deeply set eyes, prominent nose, carious teeth, cerebral and cerebellar atrophy, ventriculomegaly, basal ganglia calcification, retinal pigment epithelial mottling, severe short stature, cutaneous photosensitivity, global developmental delay, sensorineural hearing impairment, and joint contracture—the most likely diagnoses, ranked by the number of matching features, are:

1. [Cockayne syndrome type 1](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0019569)
2. [Cerebrooculofacioskeletal syndrome 1 (COFS1)](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0008955)
3. [Cockayne syndrome type 2](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0019570)
4. [de Sanctis-Cacchione syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0010217)
5. [Cockayne syndrome (general)](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0016006)
6. [Intellectual disability-feeding difficulties-developmental delay-microcephaly syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0014213)
7. [Galloway-Mowat syndrome 3](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0033007)
8. [Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to CREBBP mutations](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0008393)
9. [Emanuel syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0012176)
10. [Leukodystrophy, hypomyelinating, 15](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0054782)

The top matches—Cockayne syndrome types 1 and 2, and COFS1—are especially likely because they are known to present with many of the features described, including growth failure, microcephaly, photosensitivity, neurodevelopmental delay, and characteristic facial features.

If you would like more detail on any of these conditions or how the features match, please let me know!
